values.description:
I did a search and replace in vim: `:s@$DIR/@"$DIR"/@`

This fixes an issue where $DIR may have a space in it.

values.description:
Fix for issue #122: don't allow current task to be deleted.  Also re-raise exceptions in notify_portal(), to get a traceback at a higher level.

Tested on constellation 49, verified that the fix works.
values.title: Lock out delete of current task in cloudsimd, issue #122

summary.raw:
Fix for issue #122: don't allow current task to be deleted.  Also re-raise exceptions in notify_portal(), to get a traceback at a higher level.

Tested on constellation 49, verified that the fix works.
summary.html:
Fix for issue #122: don't allow current task to be deleted. Also re-raise exceptions in notify_portal(), to get a traceback at a higher level.

Tested on constellation 49, verified that the fix works.

values.description:
On failed task startup, we'll propagate the error back to the UI and stop the task, which fixes the "yellow light blinking forever" problem.  Fixes #123 (and more).

Also fixed the divide-by-zero error, issue #120.

Also fixes the disappearing task on startup problem, #118.
values.title: Improve task startup logic

summary.raw:
On failed task startup, we'll propagate the error back to the UI and stop the task, which fixes the "yellow light blinking forever" problem.  Fixes #123 (and more).

Also fixed the divide-by-zero error, issue #120.

Also fixes the disappearing task on startup problem, #118.
summary.html:
On failed task startup, we'll propagate the error back to the UI and stop the task, which fixes the "yellow light blinking forever" problem. Fixes #123 (and more).

Also fixed the divide-by-zero error, issue #120.

Also fixes the disappearing task on startup problem, #118.

Tool for run a command or upload a file in a set of machines

values.description:
in the top directory.

Successive calls to reboot don't work in SoftLayer, even it the machine has rebooted

The call used is "rebootDefault" http://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Hardware_Server

But I could have used:
* poweCycle
* powerOff/powerOn
* rebootHard
* rebootSoft

I am not sure which corresponds to the desired ipmi reboot

It seems to take a long time before being able to issue a reboot command, long after the machine is back.
values.title: A script called "reboot_loop" that reboots a machine (behind a router) in a loop

summary.raw:
in the top directory.

Successive calls to reboot don't work in SoftLayer, even it the machine has rebooted

The call used is "rebootDefault" http://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Hardware_Server

But I could have used:
* poweCycle
* powerOff/powerOn
* rebootHard
* rebootSoft

I am not sure which corresponds to the desired ipmi reboot

It seems to take a long time before being able to issue a reboot command, long after the machine is back.
summary.html:
in the top directory.

Successive calls to reboot don't work in SoftLayer, even it the machine has rebooted

The call used is "rebootDefault" http://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Hardware_Server

But I could have used: poweCycle powerOff/powerOn rebootHard rebootSoft

I am not sure which corresponds to the desired ipmi reboot

It seems to take a long time before being able to issue a reboot command, long after the machine is back.

values.description:
Adds a requirements.txt file [1] so that users can install dependencies by typing the following instead of manually installing boto and the softlayer libraries:

$ pip install -r requirements.txt

1 - http://www.pip-installer.org/en/latest/requirements.html
values.title: Add a requirements.txt file describing the dependencies

summary.raw:

values.description:
Added a list of ppas and packages parameters to startup script
added a check for active transaction between public ip enabling and reloading softlayer api calls
fixed bug in deafault portal content
fixed possible issues in AWS stuff due to api changes
reboot loop waits 20 mins before reboot calls to softlayer api

and some nervous pep08 changes (sorry)
